greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number triangle T(n,k) = Sum_{j=0..n} C(n-k,j-k)*C(j,n-j)*2^(n-j).
comment: First column is A084601 with e.g.f. exp(x) Bessel_I(0,2sqrt(2)x). Row sums are A098518(n+1) with e.g.f. dif(exp(x) Bessel_I(1,2sqrt(2)x)/sqrt(2)).
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
mathematica: Table[Sum[Binomial[n-k, j-k]*Binomial[j, n-j]*2^(n-j), {j, 0, n}], {n, 0, 10}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, May 09 2019 *)
program: (PARI) {T(n, k) = sum(j=0, n, binomial(n-k, j-k)*binomial(j, n-j)*2^(n-j))}; \\ _G. C. Greubel_, May 09 2019
(MAGMA) [[(&+[Binomial(n-k, j-k)*Binomial(j, n-j)*2^(n-j): j in [0..n]]): k in [0..n]]: n in [0..10]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, May 09 2019
(Sage) [[sum(binomial(n-k, j-k)*binomial(j, n-j)*2^(n-j) for j in (0..n)) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..10)] # _G. C. Greubel_, May 09 2019
(GAP) Flat(List([0..10], n-> List([0..n], k-> Sum([0..n], j-> Binomial(n-k, j-k)*Binomial(j, n-j)*2^(n-j)) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, May 09 2019
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Feb 10 2006
